title: SqueakR

However, , experimental object must created. create experiment, run following code: code creates new experiment object, name my_experiment. object saved, saved using name, along timestamp. point, ’s nothing stored experiment object except name, let’s inspect experiment structured: can see str() function experiment object 5 main groups listed : name: name just set experiment last_saved: timestamp last time experiment saved (case, time object created) groups: empty variable configured show experimental groups experimenters: empty variable configured show experimenters collected data experimental_data: empty list store data experiment Now experiment created, can start add data .
code: experiment <- create_experiment(experiment_name = "my_experiment") #> Creating new experiment... str(experiment) #> List of 5 #>  $ name             : chr "my_experiment" #>  $ last_saved       : POSIXct[1:1], format: "2022-06-21 01:36:15" #>  $ groups           : NULL #>  $ experimenters    : NULL #>  $ experimental_data: list()

title: SqueakR
text: call data exported DeepSqueak, includes detected calls length recording. However, sometimes, ’re interested calls within certain range entire recording. SqueakR add_timepoint_data() function assist : parameters add_timepoint_data() defined follows: data_path: full path data file t1: timepoint calls start extracted my_new_data object t2: timepoint calls stop extracted object. context code , ’ve just extracted calls 5-25 second region. view data ’ve extracted confirm : inspect Begin Time (s) column first table generated , ’ll notice first observation (row) represents call begins ~5 seconds. Inspecting End Time (s) column second table, last call dataset ends ~24 seconds, indicating ’ve selected 5-25 region calls.
code: my_new_data <- add_timepoint_data(data_path = "../inst/extdata/Example_Mouse_Data.xlsx", t1 = 5, t2 = 25) #> Adding call features Excel file to workspace... #> Restricting data to range: 5 to 25 seconds... # The first few rows of the dataset head(my_new_data) #> # A tibble: 6 × 17 #>      ID Label Accepted Score `Begin Time (s)` `End Time (s)` `Call Length (s)` #>   <dbl> <chr> <lgl>    <dbl>            <dbl>          <dbl>             <dbl> #> 1    12 18    TRUE     0.573             5.36           5.38            0.0152 #> 2    13 12    TRUE     0.649             6.35           6.39            0.0403 #> 3    14 26    TRUE     0.931             6.46           6.51            0.0488 #> 4    15 19    TRUE     0.969             6.59           6.66            0.0787 #> 5    16 26    TRUE     0.885             6.73           6.77            0.0460 #> 6    17 9     TRUE     0.808             6.85           6.90            0.0445 #> # … with 10 more variables: `Principal Frequency (kHz)` <dbl>, #> #   `Low Freq (kHz)` <dbl>, `High Freq (kHz)` <dbl>, `Delta Freq (kHz)` <dbl>, #> #   `Frequency Standard Deviation (kHz)` <dbl>, `Slope (kHz/s)` <dbl>, #> #   Sinuosity <dbl>, `Mean Power (dB/Hz)` <dbl>, Tonality <dbl>, #> #   `Peak Freq (kHz)` <dbl> # The last few rows of the dataset tail(my_new_data) #> # A tibble: 6 × 17 #>      ID Label Accepted Score `Begin Time (s)` `End Time (s)` `Call Length (s)` #>   <dbl> <chr> <lgl>    <dbl>            <dbl>          <dbl>             <dbl> #> 1   100 18    TRUE     0.839             23.2           23.2            0.0272 #> 2   101 8     TRUE     0.823             23.4           23.5            0.0755 #> 3   102 9     TRUE     0.910             23.5           23.5            0.0432 #> 4   103 18    TRUE     0.849             23.6           23.7            0.0550 #> 5   104 18    TRUE     0.849             23.7           23.7            0.0255 #> 6   105 18    TRUE     0.765             23.8           23.8            0.0329 #> # code: additional_data <- add_timepoint_data(data_path = "../inst/extdata/Example_Mouse_Data.xlsx", t1 = 30, t2 = 50) #> Adding call features Excel file to workspace... #> Restricting data to range: 30 to 50 seconds...  additional_data <- score_timepoint_data(data_subset = additional_data, group = "Drug",                                         experimenter = "new_experimenter") #> Summarizing call features for datapoint...  experiment <- add_to_experiment(experiment = experiment, added_data = additional_data) #> Adding summarized data to experiment object... #> Updating experiment metadata... describe_experiment(experiment) #> Experiment name: my_experiment #> Last saved: 2022-06-21 01:36:15 #> Experimenter(s): my_name, new_experimenter #> Experimental group(s): Control, Drug #> Total call datapoints: 2 #> Data for Control: 1 #> Data for Drug: 1 third_dataset <- add_timepoint_data(data_path = "../inst/extdata/Example_Mouse_Data.xlsx", t1 = 70, t2 = 90) #> Adding call features Excel file to workspace... #> Restricting data to range: 70 to 90 seconds... third_dataset <- score_timepoint_data(data_subset = third_dataset, group = "Sham",                                       experimenter = "experimenter_3") #> Summarizing call features for datapoint...  experiment <- add_to_experiment(experiment = experiment, added_data = third_dataset) #> Adding summarized data to experiment object... #> Updating experiment metadata... describe_experiment(experiment) #> Experiment name: my_experiment #> Last saved: 2022-06-21 01:36:15 #> Experimenter(s): my_name, new_experimenter, experimenter_3 #> Experimental group(s): Control, Drug, Sham #> Total call datapoints: 3 #> Data for Control: 1 #> Data for Drug: 1 #> Data for Sham: 1

ID number call Label label extracted DeepSqueak Accepted Whether call accepted (call) Score call score, DeepSqueak Begin Time (s) time call started End Time (s) time call ended Call Length (s) length call Principal Frequency (kHz) median frequency call Low Freq (kHz) minimum frequency call High Freq (kHz) maximum frequency call Delta Freq (kHz) difference maximum minimum call frequencies Frequency Standard Deviation (kHz) standard deviation call Slope (kHz/s) slope call Sinuosity call contour path length divided distance start end call Mean Power (dB/Hz)  Tonality signal/noise ratio Peak Freq frequency highest power

title: SqueakR 1.2.5
text: Merged SqueakR dashboard SqueakR package. Dashboard can now run loading package running `squeakRDashboard()’

title: SqueakR 1.2.5
text: Added fully-automatic pipeline function (autosqueakRpipeline) references Google Sheet add data without experimenter input every file Renamed experiment_pipeline() semisqueakRpipeline() Added function (add) remove data experiment object Updated vignette reflect package changes

title: SqueakR 1.2.5
text: Recreated NEWS.md file track changes package. Added functions generating experiment analyzing data experimental groups. Added visualizations including ethnograms, histograms, box-plots, correlation matrices.

title: SqueakR 1.2.5
text: Basic set functions without plotting functions Bug fixes Prepared development release Mac Prepared development release Windows

title: SqueakR 1.2.5
text: added development NEWS.md file
